entry.summary: ...HIGH SURF WITH THE HIGH TIDE FRIDAY NIGHT WEST OF THE NUSHAGAK PENINSULA... entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 15 at 12:53PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Wildfire Smoke and Air Quality Impacts... * Smoke from the Mosquito wildfire continues to produce unhealthy to hazardous air quality across the region. The latest air quality observations indicate the worst conditions to be concentrated near Truckee and extending into Reno, Sparks, and the North Valleys.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Greater Lake Tahoe Area; Lassen-Eastern Plumas-Eastern Sierra Counties; Mono; Surprise Valley California

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 15 at 3:29PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Elbert and eastern Arapahoe Counties through 415 PM MDT... At 328 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles northeast of Kiowa, or 35 miles southeast of Denver, moving northeast at 15 mph. Other storms were developing northeastward toward Deer Trail and Byers.
